Transcript:
Lillian: She’s alive! My baby is alive! Oh, 
god!

Phillip: Wait a minute. Hang on a second. Now 
listen to me. Listen to me. She is alive, but she’s not... She’s not all there. 
She’s lost some of her memory, so she’s a little bit off, but she is alive.

Alan: Now how did she survive the flood, 
Phillip?

Phillip: You know what? I’ll let her tell you 
the whole story. They should actually be here any minute. So...
Alan: Wait, they?

Phillip: Yeah, this is the bad part. She’s 
coming with Edmund.
Lillian: What?
Phillip: Yeah, they've reconciled.

Alan: Oh, for God’s sake, the man is a 
murderer!
Lillian: Yeah, I thought he'd kidnapped her.

Phillip: No, no, listen. His story is that 
that they were both abducted together.
Lillian: What does Beth say?

Phillip: Well, at the moment, she’s saying 
that he’s telling the truth. She says that he engineered their escape and that’s 
how they ended up in the desert.
Alan: Wait, wait. That’s impossible.

Phillip: I know, dad. Look, I’m having a hell 
of a hard time believing this, too.
Alan: He probably threatened her, Phillip.

Phillip: Well, he may have, he may have, and 
you know what? I don’t care. All I know is that right now my children have their 
mother back. She’s backing him up. She’s got no reason to lie.
Alan: None that we know of.

Lillian: We have to believe her. We have to 
believe her.
Phillip: Yeah.
Lorelei: Mom!

Lillian: Oh, Beth! Oh, God. Beth, oh 
sweetheart. Oh, sweetie.
Rick: Aunt Michelle?
Harley: Wake up.
Rick: Uncle Danny?
Michelle: Oh, my gosh. How did you...

Harley: I was until just a few short hours 
ago.
Michelle: What did you do?
Harley: In a jail cell.
Danny: What?

Harley: Yeah, speed trap in the middle of 
nowhere, can you believe it?
Rick: Brewster Falls, to be precise.

Harley: This overzealous cop, he throws me in 
jail just as my contractions started. Then he loses the key.
Michelle: Loses the key?
Rick: It gets better.

Harley: Yeah, yeah. Just as my water breaks, 
boom, he’s out cold.
Michelle: No?
Rick: Aitoro calls me...

Harley: Well, he and Aitoro had mixed up 
their phones.

Rick: He switched phones and he didn’t tell 
me you called.

Harley: But then he redeemed himself by 
delivering the child, which he would not have been able to do if Rick hadn’t 
showed up. And he got there just in time to deliver his own little baby. It was 
beautiful. Really, it was beautiful.
Danny: Congratulations, you guys.
Rick: Thank you.

Danny: Hey, if you want to skip Tony’s party, 
if you want to hang with what’s his name?
Harley: Jude.

Danny: Hey, Jude. That was... That had to 
happen.

Michelle: No, no, you know, well, I think the 
three of them probably need to take a nap. And Harley, if you want to crash 
here, you're more than welcome to.
Harley: Funny you should mention that...

Rick: It’s very funny you should say that, 
because I’ve asked her to stay at the house for a couple of days. Her house is 
clearly not ready.

Harley: And I think it would be a great 
opportunity for Rick to actually bond with his son.

Michelle: Well, Meta will be thrilled to have 
two babies to spoil.
Rick: I better get some supplies.
Harley: Diapers.
Rick: Diapers.
Michelle: I’m so proud of you.
Rick: Why? Why do you say that?

Michelle: Besides the fact of being a hero, 
you're going to be a great dad.
Rick: Thanks.
Catalina: There you go. You look fantastic.

Tony: Well, you, you look pretty damn hot 
yourself.

Catalina: You're very, very tense. Relax 
Tony. This is your night. Anything can happen.
Tony: Yeah, that’s what I’m afraid of.

Romeo: (Whistling) Little something from 
Carlos.

Tony: He’s not coming. He wants me to take 
care of this tonight. Now it’s all on me.
Sam: (Whistles) Glamour girl. Steaming up the place, look at you.
Marah: Hello. Well, you are in a good mood.

Sam: Well, see, it’s kind of like this. An 
old friend told me to lighten up, chill out, and enjoy what I have.

Marah: Well, if you ever see this old friend 
again, give them a kiss for me.
Sam: Marah?
Marah: Yeah.
Sam: You need a sweater?

Marah: No, I got this really terrible feeling 
all of a sudden.
Sam: About what?

Marah: About Tony’s party. I don’t think we 
should go.
Reva: I didn’t bring anything fancy, so Regina let me borrow this.
Jack: That was very kind of her.
Reva: Thank you for inviting me to dinner.

Jack: My pleasure. You deserve to enjoy 
yourself.
Reva: How’s the shoulder?

Jack: Holding up. That is a beautiful dress. 
Why don’t you do a little spin for me?

Reva: Not exactly ripped from the runway, is 
it? That’s a term that we use where I come from. But it is a fine dress, and I’m 
proud to be wearing it. What?
Jack: This lace rose. It does not belong.
Reva: Better? Colonel Robechaux?

Jack: I’m afraid you caught me off guard, 
looking like that.

Regina: Take this to General Hudson at his 
quarters with my compliments. Tell him I look forward to seeing him shortly. Go 
on.
Girl: Yes, ma'am.

Reva: It must be hard sitting on the 
sidelines watching when other people are fighting a battle you feel so strongly 
about.

Jack: My feelings about the war might 
surprise you, Miss Shayne, but I assure you, I am still fighting the battle that 
needs to be fought.
Reva: Oh, of course. I didn’t mean...

Jack: It’s all right. It’s confusing, I know 
that. Like tonight, entertaining a Yankee general right here in my home, and not 
just any general, but the beast himself, Mordecai Hudson. Like breaking bread 
with the devil.
Reva: Your wife’s idea?

Jack: My wife is strong-willed, as you've 
noticed, I’m sure. But tonight... Tonight you are not my nurse. Tonight you are 
an invited guest in this home. And my only cause that I am concerned with 
tonight is your entertainment.

Reva: Well, you're already entertaining me, 
believe me.Thank you for letting me borrow your dress.

Regina: What? That old thing? I was glad to 
put to use. It’s terribly out of fashion, but it suits you.

Jack: I have a fine idea. Perhaps we can show 
General Hudson what New Orleans really thinks of him. We will sneak off to the 
French quarter for dinner....
Regina: Jack...

Jack: ...And leave him here to fend for 
himself. Perhaps he will learn something about the rules of engagement.

Regina: This dinner is about our survival. We 
must align ourselves with the north to save our plantation, and the only way is 
to curry favors with that general.
Jack: You! What do you think you're doing?

Horton: Sir, it is my job to safeguard the 
General.

Regina: Why, General Hudson, it’s wonderful 
for you to come. It’s our greatest pleasure to service New Orleans' most 
distinguished guest.

Hudson: The pleasure is all mine, I assure 
you. Thank you, Madame. Of all the inhabitants of this fair city, your welcome 
has been the warmest.

Regina: General, you haven’t introduced your 
guest.

Hudson: My companion for this evening, Miss 
Vandergelt, my compatriot, Captain Norton.
Regina: This is Jack’s dedicated nurse, Reva.

Reva: It’s a pleasure to make your 
acquaintance.
Hudson: Likewise.

Reva: I understand you are the beast of New 
Orleans.

Hudson: Well, the woman speaks her mind. What 
else have you heard?

Lillian: I’m just going to hold you and hold you and never, ever going to let 
you go.

Lorelei: Mom, I’m so glad to see you. I just 
missed you.

Lillian: Oh, sweetheart, you know during that 
terrible memorial service we had for you, I kept screaming inside that I didn’t 
believe you were dead, that you would come back, and now look. You're here.

Alan: I think I have just experienced my 
first miracle.
Lorelei: Alan...
Lillian: Sweetheart.

Lorelei: Now, Phillip, please. Let’s not turn 
this into a spitting contest. Edmund may not be a saint, but he’s not 
responsible for what happened in Mexico, either. In fact, I owe him my life.
Alan: Of course you do.

Lillian: Honey, we thought you two were 
separated in the flood.

Lorelei: Well, yes, but only after he tried 
to warn me.
Lillian: Tell me what happened to you, okay?

Lorelei: Well, I grabbed on to a branch, and 
I just held on for dear life, and eventually I was able to drag myself up on to 
a bank, but like I told Phillip, I must have hit my head on a rock or something, 
because I just blacked out. And now I get these snapshot memories with big holes 
in between.
Phillip: Are you still having the blackouts?

Lorelei: That’s what took me so long to get 
home.

Lillian: Oh, you didn’t know where your home 
was?

Lorelei: But I found my way back. And I found 
something else, too. It took this whole ordeal to make me realize that I’m meant 
to be with Edmund. And I know how hard that is for all of you to accept, but I 
hope you'll at least try.

Rick: I’m just afraid I’ll never want to go back to work. I love that kid so 
much. It’s just going to be impossible to tear myself away from him.

Danny: I know the feeling. Michelle? Honey? 
Come on, we got to get going.

Rick: Whoa, hot mama. What happened to my 
sister?

Michelle: While the resident comedian here is 
grabbing supplies, if you need anything, just ask Meta.

Harley: I’m sure that Meta’s probably got her 
hands full with Robbie, but thanks, I will.

Michelle: Oh, the present’s in the living 
room. (Knock on door)
Harley: Who is it?

Romeo: So how are we going to make sure Sam doesn’t shoot off his mouth to Marah 
and connect us to the harbor project?

Tony: Hey, look, I know what I have to do, 
all right? And I don’t need anybody breathing down my neck!

Romeo: Hey, what’s up with the attitude? I’m 
here to help you. All you got to do is say the word. If you don’t want to get 
involved now...
Tony: I am involved, man!
Marah: No, no I mean it. We should skip the party. Hey, let’s go bowling.

Sam: Dressed like this? Come on, Marah, we 
talked about this. We're together now and we want the whole world to know, 
right?

Marah: I know. I just... I just have this 
horrible feeling.

Sam: Well, get rid of it. No horrible 
feelings, only good feelings tonight. You look way too beautiful to sit in a 
dorm room all night. Miss Lewis, I promise you a night to remember.
Marah: Okay, we'll go.
Sam: That a girl.

Marah: Only if you promise me that we'll go 
back to the dorm room afterward so we can be alone.
Hudson: Rumor has it your plantation has fallen on hard times.

Regina: Well, after the war, things were 
hard.
Hudson: Oh, too little, too late.

Jack: Your men have already torched our 
crops, damaged our main house. We will rebuild this house with our own money.

Hudson: Confederate currency isn’t worth the 
paper it’s printed on.
Jack: We'll be fine, don’t you worry.

Hudson: Do I look like I’m worried? Word has 
it that the Robechaux' resources aren’t what they used to be.

Jack: I invite you into my house against my 
better judgment; you come swaggering in here, and insult me. I have half a mind 
to throw you out on your tail!
Regina: Jack...

Hudson: And I have half a mind to throw you 
into prison, and that is not an empty threat.

Regina: Gentlemen, please. There are more 
appropriate topics. General, we have prepared a lovely feast in your honor. 
Let’s enjoy it, shall we?

Jack: 
Ma'am.

Lillian: I thought you were gone forever, honey. And now that you're back, I 
don’t want to lose you again. So if that means you want me to accept Edmund, of 
course. I’ll do anything you want. I’ll accept Edmund.
Alan: God give me strength.

Phillip: You know what? I’m going to go get 
Lizzie.
Lorelei: Okay.
Phillip: Dad, join me, please.
Lillian: You're going to see James.

Lorelei: Mother, could you get me a cup of 
tea? Mommy, I’m being so formal.

Lillian: I’ll get you anything you want, 
sweetie, but you won’t move. You stay right here, okay, safe and sound.

Edmund: Well done. Although you nearly caused 
me a second stroke at Towers. I didn’t think you were remotely ready to pull 
this thing off.

Lorelei: Eddie. I have never seen a more 
beautiful place in my whole life. Hey, hey, I want to ask you something. Ain’t 
that... Ain’t that what they call that art nouveau or art deco, or something?

Edmund: Don’t point. And if it takes an 
exorcism, we will strike the word "ain’t" from your vocabulary.

Lorelei: Relax. I see why you put me through 
boot camp. And I want to let you know something-- I appreciate it.

Edmund: Well, you're about to depreciate and 
rather quickly, I might add, if you don’t pass this next test.
Lorelei: What’s that?

Edmund: The children. You have to be 
extremely careful, especially with Lizzie. There is no fooling an innocent.
Lorelei: Could you speak in English, please?

Edmund: No one will see through you more 
quickly than a child, and you're about to come face-to-face with your own 
daughter, which means you have to play this to make her believe you are Beth.
(Latin music playing)
Michelle: Hey! Happy birthday.
Tony: Thanks.

Danny: Getting old, man. Catching up with me. 
Guess I’m going to have to start showing you a little respect.

Tony: You can’t even say happy birthday 
without making some left-handed comment, can you?

Danny: Come on, I didn’t mean anything by it. 
Tony, lighten up. Seriously, I mean, if we can’t be in the same room together 
without arguing...

Tony: Then we can’t be in the same room 
together.

Danny: What the hell is his problem? I mean, 
what did I say? I didn’t say anything.

Michelle: I’m sure he’s just nervous, you 
know, big party, big expectations.

Danny: Whatever. Let’s just eat and get out 
of here. Come on.

Ray: Bro. My little brother, all grown up. Look at you. This is a good idea, 
bring the family closer. What’s up, Tony?

Tony: It’s like you say, I’m the man now. I 
got some tough choices to make, so...

Ray: Well, they're usually not so tough once 
you weigh the good and the bad. Want to talk about it?
Tony: No. Maybe. I don’t know, Ray. Maybe.

Ray: Listen, whatever’s bothering you, trust 
your gut. I have faith you'll do the right thing, no matter what the problem is. 
Come on, let’s have fun.
Marah: You know, ever since we got here, you mentioned that guava salsa you had.

Sam: Right, right, right, right, right. You 
want to try some?
Marah: Yeah.

Sam: I saw some, it’s over here. I’ll go get 
it.
Marah: Happy birthday. Nice party.
Tony: Yeah, Catalina did all the work.
Marah: She did a real bang-up job.
Tony: Hey, everyone’s having a good time.
Marah: Want to dance?
Tony: What?

Marah: I mean, why not? We both moved on, 
right? You love this song and it’s your birthday. (Laughs)
Catalina: Wow, you're like a new man.

Sam: Yeah, and you're the lady responsible. 
You told me to chill out, remember, and to enjoy my life a little?

Catalina: So, you didn’t say anything to 
Marah, did you?

Sam: Like what? "No, I didn’t save your dad. 
No, I’m not your hero, and I’ve been lying all the time?" No, I didn’t say that.

Catalina: Sam... Sam, you're a good, good 
guy. You deserve to be Marah’s hero. Doesn’t matter about the details. You two 
look good together.
Sam: Like you and Tony?
Tony: You look good, Marah.
Marah: Thanks. So do you.

Tony: I'd better. I mean, if you don’t look 
good on your birthday, you might as well throw in the towel, right?

Marah:(Laughs) Do you feel different now 
that you're older?
Tony: Yeah. Yeah, you better believe it.
Hudson: Captain, would you escort miss Vandergelt to the carriage?
Norton: Certainly, sir.

Regina: Take this to general Hudson at his 
quarters with my compliments. Tell him I look forward to seeing him shortly. Go 
on.
Maid: Yes, madam.
Horton: Almost as beautiful as you are.
Regina: Jack...
Reva: What is it?

Regina: You've got to rest. Stop pushing 
yourself so hard. I’ll show the general out.
Reva: Let me help.
Jack: I’ll be all right, thank you.

Regina: You are playing a very dangerous 
game.
Hudson: I’m not the only one.

Edmund: Whatever you do, for God’s sake, please don’t choke. This poor girl’s 
been through enough already.
Lorelei: Hi, Lizzie.
Lizzie: Mommy!

Edmund: Lady Elizabeth. I know... I know, you 
blame me for your mother going away, but look, here she is. I’ve brought her 
back for you, haven’t I? It’s going to be as though nothing ever changed.
Lizzie: I missed you so much!
Harley: Yeah, so where did you find my phone?
Gus: Where is everybody?
Harley: Out.
Gus: Brewster Falls.
Harley: And you've had it this whole time?

Gus: I just picked it up. I just came back 
from there.
Harley: Brewster Falls? You went back? Why?

Gus: Quaint little town. I was trying to 
scare up a little new business, you know?

Harley: Quaint? It’s like a ghost town, and 
it’s about 60 miles from here anyway.

Gus: Right. Well, I need all the business I 
can get.
Harley: Mm-hmm.
Gus: I got to go. Thanks.

Harley: No, no. See, you didn’t go back there 
trolling for clients. Uh-uh. You went back there because you helped me deliver 
my child there, and I think... I think that actually might have touched you a 
little bit. See, I see right through you, Aitoro. Remember I’m the one person in 
this town who actually knows you have a heart.
Rick: Hey, Mel.
Mel: Hey, Papa, congratulations.

Rick: Aw, you shouldn’t have done this. Thank 
you. Thanks so much. Can I open this?
Mel: Yes, please.

Rick: A tympanic thermometer. Thank you. You 
shouldn’t have done this.
Mel: I knew you'd appreciate it.

Rick: Well, I appreciate it. Now that I’ve 
thanked you for a gift, can I ask you for a favor?
Mel: Sure.

Rick: Since you are one of the most talented, 
gifted residents I’ve ever met in my entire life.

Mel: Odd. We're nowhere near a movie theater, 
yet I detect a scent of butter. Come on, out with it.

Rick: All right. Can you cover for me in E.R? 
Just for a few days.
Mel: That’s it? The big wind-up?
Rick: A week.
Mel: Whatever you need.
Rick: Two weeks?

Mel: Okay, now you're pushing it. So, what 
did you name the baby?
Rick: His name is Jude.
Mel: Solid. Biblical. I like it.

Rick: Well, actually Harley came up with it. 
It was one of her favorite songs, something like that. Oh, by the way, I haven’t 
shared this with you, she’s going to be staying with me for a while.
Mel: Oh, like some sort of test run?

Rick: I don’t know. I mean, we'll see how it 
goes.
Mel: That’s great. I’m happy for you.
Rick: Am I dumping too much on you?
Mel: No.

Rick: If I am, I want you to be honest with 
me. I mean, can you handle this thing in E.R by yourself?

Mel: Oh, yeah. Absolutely. So I guess I’ll 
just take a rain check on that sci-fi fest. You'll have your hands full for a 
while. But hey, it’s not like you don’t have a great excuse. There will be other 
festivals.

Rick: Uh-huh. Oh, yeah. I can see it all now. 
You're going to forget all about me now that I’m a house daddy.

Mel: Are you kidding? I can’t wait for Jude 
to grow up so we can drag his dad out to the cool films.

Rick: There you go. Well, I was on a diaper 
run, and that’s what I need to do, so I’m going to go get some diapers.
Mel: Okay, you'd better hurry.

Rick: Okay, bye. Oh, and listen, I’m going to 
call you later so we can reschedule that movie date. I just need to get 
resettled first, okay?
Mel: Wait, Rick. Don’t go.
Ray: Nice party, huh?
Michelle: Yeah.
Danny: Yeah, Catalina did a really good job.

Ray: She did. That she did. You guys hear 
about Tony’s new roommate?
Michelle: Uh-uh.
Ray: Carmen moved in to the guesthouse.
Michelle: What? Tony let her?
Danny: She’s not coming here tonight, is she?

Ray: No, no. He made it perfectly clear that 
she wasn’t invited. Come on, you guys. Let’s go check out the picadillo; I hear 
it’s great.
Michelle: No thanks.
Danny: We already ate.
Michelle: We're trying to burn it off.

Ray: Well, in that case, more for me, then. 
Congratulations, uncle, auntie.
Danny: Thanks.
Ray: See you later.
Danny: Do you feel like dancing anymore?
Michelle: Not really.

Danny: You feel like getting out of this 
house?
Michelle: Yeah.
Danny: Let’s go. Come on.
Tony: Let’s do it.

Romeo: In front of all these people? Are you 
nuts?
Tony: This is what you're going to do.

Romeo: I’ve been watching you. Where did you 
get those moves?
Sam. He’s a really good dancer.
Romeo: Not as good as you.
Marah: Well, he taught me everything I know.

Romeo: Mmm. I could teach you a thing or two. 
What’s the matter? You don’t like dancing with me?
Marah: I just want to get back to Sam.

Romeo: Sure you do. The guy’s a big hero. 
Saved your daddy, fingered Felix Chavez.
Marah: What are you talking about?

Romeo: You don’t have to pretend with me. I 
know the score.
Marah: Why are you grinning at me like that?
Romeo: Cause I know something that you don’t.
Marah: What?

Romeo: Sam didn’t know who was behind those 
payoffs in San Cristobel’s and he sure as hell didn’t clear your dad.

Marah: Okay, you're officially getting on my 
nerves now.

Romeo: Well that’s too bad, 'cause Sammy’s 
not your hero, I am. Go on. Ask him. I dare you.
Gus: All right, so I’m a human being. So what?
Harley: (Laughs)
Gus: What? This isn’t funny.
Harley: Maybe not to you.

Gus: You know, a couple of years ago there 
was a serial killer running around Washington, D.C., And the bureau gave me a 
big old plaque for taking him down, and I thought that I was pretty hot, I 
thought I was pretty amazing.
Harley: You thought that, huh?

Gus: And I never thought I could top that. 
But when I realized that you and the baby were in danger, delivering that child 
into this world became the most important thing to me in my life. Everything 
else just seemed to evaporate.

Harley: Well, I’ll never forget what you did 
for him... I mean, me.

Gus: Helping you deliver Jude has been the 
proudest moment of my life so far.
Harley: Thank you.
Gus: Why did you go back to Springfield?

Harley: To be near my family and my friends, 
and to also have the baby with Rick. I mean, you know, he’s the father, so I 
thought it was the least I could do for him.

Gus: Of course. Of course. But that’s not why 
you came back.
Harley: No? What is the reason?
Gus: You came back for me.
Lizzie: I used all the right colors. Do you like it?
Lorelei: I love it.
Alan: Well, why don’t we have some dinner?
Lizzie: I get to sit next to mommy.
Phillip: Why don’t you go get washed up?

Alan: Beth, I expect you'll want Lizzie to 
stay with you at Towers.

Edmund: Well, we'd like to take her back this 
evening, but if...

Lorelei: If it’s not too much to ask, I'd 
like to stay here, at least until we find a permanent home. Lizzie’s happy here, 
and she needs stability.

Phillip: Yes. You're always welcome to stay 
here, you know that.
Lorelei: And Edmund, too?

Edmund: Beth, I really don’t think that’s the 
best idea...

Alan: No, no, no, Edmund. The more, the 
merrier.
Edmund: Thank you, but I don’t think...
Lorelei: Alan, thank you.
Alan: Well, shall we, Lillian?
Lillian: Oh, yes.

Lorelei: Phillip, from what Edmund tells me, 
you've pretty much taken charge of my estate, and obviously I’ll need access to 
those accounts again.
Phillip: Sure, that’s no problem.
Lorelei: And Edmund will need access as well.
Phillip: Okay, to which accounts?
Lorelei: Everything.
Phillip: What about your inheritance?

Edmund: Phillip, I think you heard what Beth 
said. Beth, we'll talk about this later, all right? I’ll be back in a minute.

Lorelei: Oh, Eddie. You've been a naughty 
boy. You've been hiding something from me, and I’m going to find out what. It’s 
dinner time.

Hudson: It’s very simple. Either you convince your husband to fork over a cut of 
the plantation, or I will expose him as a confederate spy and he will hang.

Regina: You said you wouldn’t hurt him. You 
promised.

Hudson: I lied. Ooh, your wifely devotion is 
very touching, considering...

Regina: I’ll do whatever you want, just don’t 
hurt Jack.

Hudson: Very well, for now. But you will be 
mine sooner than you think. What about the Yankee dispatches?

Regina: Intercepted as if they never existed. 
No one will be the wiser, I guarantee it.
(Door closes)
Hudson: What was that?
